body: @blueorangutan test
@rhtyd a Trillian-Jenkins test job (centos7 mgmt + kvm-centos7) has been kicked to run smoke tests
@rhtyd a Trillian-Jenkins test job (centos7 mgmt + kvm-centos7) has been kicked to run smoke tests
@marcaurele from me you have an LGTM

It will be difficult to accept this at this point with more than 150 PRs pending review/merge, as this will potentially cause merge conflicts on all of them. Accepting this will also fail cherry-picking and doing branch maintenance. @marcaurele pardon my ignorance, except for cosmetics changes in file-systems/directories/paths what are the pros of such refactoring? My understanding is our file structure does not follow the `maven-standard`, (given our `ant` build-system history) however it has not created a problem for developers or users.
@resmo are you planning to work on option 3 (from dev@ ML) or go with this change (drop by default) ?
LGTM, the travis job `TestStorageTags:tearDown` failure is known intermittent failure.
LGTM @borisstoyanov, I've remove duplicates from .travis.yml and re-sorted them. Can you re-run tests on changed components tests one more time?
@yvsubhash please check errors
@blueorangutan package
@borisstoyanov a Jenkins job has been kicked to build packages. I'll keep you posted as I make progress.

LGTM, pending testing.

@rafaelweingartner looks reasonable

LGTM for Testing
 
1. Create a zone set-up with 2 host in one cluster.
2. set system.vm.use.local.storage parameter to "true" in Global Settings.
3. Create Compute Offerings with Storage Type option selected as local.
4. Create Disk Offerings with Storage Type option selected as local.
4. In Zone enable local storage for user vms option selected. 
5. Take recurring snapshot for Root-Disk.
6. Migrate the instance to another host.
7. After Migration snapshots from source host local storage are cleaned  up.

@rhtyd done
@rafaelweingartner thanks a lot.
